Art and craft goods supplier and custom framing service. Provides art supplies, picture framing, and locally-made art pieces. Serves both artists and collectors in the Castries area.

Art institute dedicated to the legacy of Saint Lucia's renowned St. Omer family of painters, including the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer (designer of the national flag) and sons Luigi and Alwyn St. Omer. Community crafts centre in Choiseul, an area renowned for its traditional pottery, woodcarving, and palm craft heritage. Hub for traditional Saint Lucian craft techniques using local materials.

Born 1952 in Choiseul, completely self-taught master wood carver. One of Saint Lucia's most renowned sculptors. Collaborated with Anse Chastanet for many years. Notable works include 'The Kiss', 'Rainforest' in the Treehouse restaurant, totem poles, and carved stair rails. Creates masks featuring scenes from Saint Lucian life. Can be contacted through Anse Chastanet Resort.

Major hits: 'Lit,' 'One Woman,' 'Flavor,' 'Issa Vibe' (feat. Machel Montano). Available for carnival, festival, and event performances. Booking via Team Foxx: dexterrthomas@gmail.com

Most successful Saint Lucian soca artiste with 23 competition titles ‚Äî 8 Road March, 6 Power Soca Monarchs, 3 Caribbean Soca Monarchs, 2 Groovy Soca Monarchs. International performer from Saint Lucian stages to Trinidad Soca Monarch finals and Madison Square Garden. 2024 Soca Monarch Champion. Available for carnival, festival, and corporate events.

Groovy Soca Monarch 2015. Born in Castries, started music in church, transitioned to soca in 2007. Hit single 'Allez' brought Caribbean-wide fame. Has shared stage with Luther Vandross, Patti LaBelle, John Legend, Shaggy, Ne-Yo. Available for corporate events, showcases, festivals, concerts, carnival (US, Caribbean, UK). Booking via Music Saint Lucia.

Young talented soca artist from Castries. Known for catch phrase 'Okay Lay Lay.' Hits: 'Pretty On Purpose,' 'Start a Fyah,' 'Cherry Cassava,' 'Ou Dou,' 'Spoil You.' Billboard's Caribbean Artists to Watch 2025. Nominated Best New Soca Artist at Caribbean Music Awards 2024. Management: DAUS Management.

Dennery Segment king with 2.63 million+ global Spotify streams. 17+ local awards including Dennery Segment Artist of the Year and Outstanding Youth in Volunteerism 2021. Billboard's 10 Caribbean Artists to Watch 2025. Performed at World Creole Music Festival (Dominica), Miami Carnival. Hit collab: 'Woolay' with Mighty.

Saint Lucian R&B fusion singer, songwriter, and musician. Genres: R&B, Pop, Hip Hop, Reggae, Dancehall, Soca, Zouk, Kompa, Afrobeats. Headlined Saint Lucia Jazz & Arts Festival 2023. Nina Simone Artistic Excellence Award 2025. Caribbean Music Awards nominations for Artist of the Year. Albums: 'Shades' (2017), 'Questions' (2023). Booking: mrmusicbookings@gmail.com

Grammy-nominated jazz guitarist, composer, and producer. First Saint Lucian with voting rights at the Grammy Awards (2016). Selected as judge for 58th Annual Grammy Awards. Started career with the legendary Tru Tones band. Praised by George Benson and Stanley Jordan. Available for festivals, corporate events, jazz cruises. Management: W Entertainment (wemgmt.com).

Reggae band blending roots reggae with acoustic rock and afro-folk. Taj Weekes is a singer/songwriter, UNICEF Champion for Children, and founder of They Often Cry Outreach (TOCO) children's charity. Performs internationally. Available for festivals, corporate events, and private bookings.

Afrobeat/Zouk/Dancehall duo ‚Äî Jean Atem Farah (Luja) and Tylor Ryie Auguste (Ryie). Unique blend of Dancehall, R&B and pop with Caribbean appeal. First Saint Lucian artiste to have a hit with Machel Montano. Won 'Artiste Award' at Digicel Machel Montano Music Academy 2017. Booking: lmg@lucianstyle.com

Prolific Saint Lucian jazz saxophonist. Began career at 15 in the Royal St. Lucia Police Band on clarinet, later mastered saxophone. Performed with almost every group on the island and the West Indies Jazz Band touring Europe and the Caribbean. Studied under Bobby Watson and Wynton Marsalis Band. Formed his own group 'Third Eye.' One of the most talented musicians of the Caribbean.

Renowned jazz vocalist and former head of woodwind department at St. Lucia School of Music. St. Lucia Medal of Merit (Gold) 2004 for meritorious service in music. Performed throughout Caribbean jazz circuit. Has opened for Tanya Maria, Patti La Belle, Anita Baker, Spyro Gyra. Regular performer at Saint Lucia Jazz & Arts Festival.
One of the most prolific singer/songwriter/producers of R&B from the Caribbean. Singer and composer with international recognition. Available through Export Saint Lucia / Music Saint Lucia platform.

Dennery Segment soca artist and songwriter. Hit single 'Split In The Middle' (2017) amassed 17 million+ YouTube views. Pioneer alongside Motto and Mighty in incorporating English lyrics into Dennery Segment, raising the genre's international profile. Team Foxx Music artist.

Dennery Segment/Soca/Zouk/Dancehall artist. Also known as Belpap. Top Dennery artist who crystallized the genre with hit riddims. Songs: 'Feh Ah,' 'Sue Say,' 'Bad in BumBum,' 'Back Bend.' Performed at World Creole Music Festival (Dominica). Links and socials via Linktree.
Saint Lucian reggae and dancehall musician. Album 'Gsum Everyday' (2023). Growing following with songs causing a stir in the music business. YouTube: youtube.com/channel/UCdfJ5twGHo1sqrjmCF2KkLg

Rock and reggae fusion band. Started as surfers in Saint Lucia. Cut their teeth in Rodney Bay's bar scene in the late 1990s. Opened for Malcolm Jamal Warner's band at Jazz on the Square (2001). Dennery Segment soca artist. Regular performer at Lucian Carnival D'Vibes events and Miami Carnival. One of the key Dennery Segment artists alongside Motto, Umpa, Subance, Blackboy. Team Foxx Music collaborator.

Saint Lucia's newest mas band, debuting in 2025 Carnival with theme 'Seduction & Scandal.' A carnival band inspiring connection, cultural pride, and unforgettable memories. Team includes Giovanni Charles, Clare Alfred, and Rogers Fernando Glace.
Premier J'ouvert band ‚Äî 'Jouvert Done Right!' Caters to a more mature crowd with an organized, high-energy J'ouvert experience during Saint Lucia Carnival.

Celebrated Saint Lucian actor, choreographer, and dancer. Trained in RAD Classical Ballet and Modern Dance with ISTD. Holds French teaching diplomas in Jazz and Contemporary Dance. Works span many decades of Saint Lucian artistic output. Major painter whose work speaks to important aspects of being Saint Lucian, Caribbean, and human. Email: acstlicia@gmail.com
services.no: Email: acstlicia@gmail.com

services.d: One of Saint Lucia's premier visual artists. Began drawing at age 4, serious painting at 21. Received UNESCO scholarship in 1985 to study art at Jamaica's Edna Manley College of the Visual and Performing Arts, graduating with honours and distinction. Served as Art Officer for Ministry of Education 1988-2004. Developed 'Organometrics' ‚Äî a distinctive technique combining organic and geometric elements with vibrant colors, textures, and parallel lines creating 3D illusions. Works in charcoal, watercolours, pencil, and oils. Painting hangs in the Bank of England Museum. Exhibited in UK, USA, Dominican Republic, Barbados, and Trinidad & Tobago. Mentored emerging artists including Rufus Darcie. Member of Artist Circle.

Painter with over 20 years of experience. Known for 'Mask Parade' abstract paintings with thick tribal tones related to ancestral roots and spiritual themes. Also creates hand-painted bottles, watercolor sketches, and set designs for theatrical productions. Graduated from Sir Arthur Lewis Community College. First 'Mask Parade' Collection exhibited in 2011, toured Dominican Republic, Martinique, Grenada, Guadeloupe, and England. Represented Saint Lucia at CARIFESTA four times. Collaborated with Nobel laureate Derek Walcott on theatrical productions. Work featured in University of Nebraska's 'Prairie Schooner' and 'Caribbean Beat'. Facilitates national lantern festival. Best Creative Design Award 2003 at M&C Fine Arts. Member of Artist Circle.

Intuitive self-taught artist and Clinical Psychologist. Specializes in acrylics and mixed media. Views art as a vehicle for healing ‚Äî transmuting fear into hope, pain into joy. Notable works include 'Strange Fruit', 'Piton Dream', 'Village Life', and 'Dauphin Spirit'. Serves as Public Relations Officer for Artist Circle St. Lucia. Advocates for 'Connecting Community Through Art'. Offers small group workshops. Member of Artist Circle.

Visual artist and painter, born 1954. First came to Saint Lucia in 1981 for a summer teaching project, fell in love with the island, and returned permanently. Known for paintings such as 'Woman and Child at the River'. Self-employed artist. Member of Artist Circle St. Lucia.

Originally from Vashon Island, Washington (near Seattle). Has lived in Saint Lucia off and on since 1983, now permanently. Painter using various mediums including oils, acrylics, clay, wire, wax-resist, and found objects. Two years of art school at the Factory of Visual Arts (affiliate of University of Washington). Member of Artist Circle St. Lucia.

Painter and daughter of veteran artist Ken 'Scotty' Lawrence. Featured in first father-daughter joint exhibition at Alliance Francaise 'Perspectives' show (2016). Member of Artist Circle St. Lucia. Email: acstlicia@gmail.com
Visual artist and member of Artist Circle St. Lucia. Featured work in the 'Perspectives' exhibition at Alliance Francaise (2016). Limited online presence; contact through Artist Circle.

Born 1958 in Castries. Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer (designer of Saint Lucia's National Flag). Master draughtsman and colorist. Studied Art at Edna Manley School for the Visual Arts (Jamaica) and Video Production at Portsmouth College (England). Designed Saint Lucia's National Independence Monument. Known for 'Moon Dancer' Masquerade series. Specializes in paintings documenting Saint Lucian folklore, traditional carnival characters, and cultural heritage. Awarded Saint Lucia Medal of Honour, Gold (2021) and Catapult Caribbean Art Award (2020). Director of St. Omer Art Institute. Published in Sands Tourism Magazine, CIMPEX Home Companion, and Wakonte children's books. Also does murals ‚Äî restored the Faux-A-Chaud Mural. Caribbean Creative Network profile: caribbeancreativenetwork.org/profile/alwyn_st-omer

Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer. Taught art at St Mary's College for 20 years before retiring at age 40 to paint full time. Paintings displayed at Anse Chastanet Gallery, Alliance Francaise, and Orlando's restaurant in Soufriere. Known for swirling brush strokes creating energy and movement. Often features characters from Saint Lucia's carnivals and rural life. Explores and combines modern with traditional themes. Subject of a 2013 short film 'Luigi' by Jelani Paul exploring his painting process. Featured in CDF Emancipation Art Exhibition (2014).

Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer. Visual artist specializing in paintings of the masquerade tradition. Featured in 'St. Omer ‚Äì A Family of Artists' exhibition at Mexican Embassy, Vigie (January 2017). Part of the renowned St. Omer family of painters.

Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer. Visual artist who also works as a graffiti artist/painter alongside brother Alwyn. Featured in 'St. Omer ‚Äì A Family of Artists' exhibition at Mexican Embassy, Vigie (January 2017). Part of the renowned St. Omer family of painters.

Dr. Christopher Anthony Cox, born 1967 in Toronto to Saint Lucian father and Jamaican mother, raised in Saint Lucia from age 5. Among the few recognized wildlife and environmental artists in the Caribbean. Works primarily in watercolour and acrylic capturing birds, reptiles, and forest environments. Joined St. Lucia Forestry Department 20+ years ago; fieldwork awakened his appreciation for wildlife. Featured in 'A Guide to the Birds of the West Indies' (Princeton University Press, 1998). Published in regional Caribbean Conservation Association bird poster series. Solo show at Alliance Francaise (2005). Inspired by Robert Bateman, Don R. Eckelberry, and Audubon. Shop: shopchriscoxoriginals.com. Email: chriscoxoriginals@gmail.com
services.a: LaToc hillside, Castries (studio); also spends time in Panama
services.no: Email: chriscoxoriginals@gmail.com

services.d: Fine artist and son of Nobel Prize-winning poet and playwright Derek Walcott. Uses bright, light acrylic paint applied with controlled brush strokes, influenced by four years of formal architectural training at Boston University. Paintings filled with Saint Lucian imagery ‚Äî scenic landscapes and close-up foliage in vivid colour with architectural precision. 'Io√ºanalao' exhibition at Inner Gallery, Bois d'Orange featured island vistas (title refers to Saint Lucia's Amerindian name meaning 'where the iguana is found'). 'Lucian Landscapes' collection launched at Baywalk Mall.

Born 1947 in Castries, Saint Lucia. Moved to London at age 12, studied at the Slade School of Fine Art alongside David Hockney, Howard Hodgkin, and John Hoyland. OBE recipient. Early figurative works informed by Caribbean heritage transitioned to radical abstraction in late 1970s. Works in the collections of Tate Britain, British Museum, Brooklyn Museum, Victoria and Albert Museum, and Arts Council of Great Britain. Awards include British Council Award (1973), John Simon Guggenheim Fellowship (1978), and Albert Nelson Marquis Lifetime Achievement Award (2018). Featured in Sotheby's 'Journey into Light' and Christie's artist profiles. Represented by Cedric Bardawil Gallery (London).
services.a: Born in Castries; studios in London and California

services.d: First dedicated art gallery on the island of Saint Lucia, founded by Buki Cahane, a Nigerian-born art curator. Spacious, well-lit gallery providing professional viewing of local artworks. Features young (age 18+) and established Saint Lucian artists including Adjani John, Junette Alexander, Gilroy Hippolyte, Alcina Nolley, and Alwin Joseph. Monthly themed exhibitions including youth art, all-female shows, and charity collaborations. Open Mon-Fri 9am-3pm and by appointment. P.O. Box 1146, Castries. Email: mecuratorstlucia@gmail.com
services.a: STAR Publishing complex, Massade, Gros Islet
services.no: Email: mecuratorstlucia@gmail.com

services.d: Painter taught by Luigi St. Omer (son of Sir Dunstan St. Omer). Laid down brushes in 1994 to concentrate on banking career and family, but has returned to painting. Featured at MeCurator Art Gallery. Email: caribbeanpieces@hotmail.com

Young Saint Lucian visual artist from Morne Dudon. Travelled to Jamaica to study fine arts at Edna Manley College of the Visual and Performing Arts because teacher training in visual arts is not offered in Saint Lucia. Art aimed at facilitating meaningful discourse on societal issues. Aspires to establish an art residency in Saint Lucia. Featured at MeCurator Art Gallery. Believes art reflects both artist's and society's voice.

Saint Lucia's premier Landscape and Fine Art photographer. Born and raised in Saint Lucia, began photographing at age 9. Left in 1979 for business degree at Arizona State University, worked in banking in Downtown LA. A trip to Yosemite and seeing Ansel Adams' work inspired his photography career. Returned to Saint Lucia. Won many awards. Published in numerous books, magazines, and calendars locally and in the US/UK. Also published 'A Year in the Life of Saint Lucia' (Blurb). Member of Artist Circle.

Saint Lucian graffiti artist and painter. Featured in Pascal Maillet-Contoz's photography exhibition 'Murals of Saint Lucia: Street Art, Urban Cultures and Identity' at Alliance Francaise (February 2018). Works alongside the St. Omer brothers in the island's street art scene.

Saint Lucian visual artist. Featured in the 'Life in Colour' exhibition at La Place Carenage as part of the 2024 Jazz and Arts Festival's Art and the City programme. Part of a curated show featuring over 18 Saint Lucian artists with more than 80 artworks.

Emerging Saint Lucian painter. Specializes in 'acrylic pour' technique ‚Äî pouring acrylic paints directly on canvas without brushes. Also works as an interior decorator. First-time exhibition participant at 'Life in Colour' show (La Place Carenage, Jazz and Arts Festival 2024) with three pieces on display.

Artist and daughter-in-law of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer. Specializes in crochet dressmaking and textile art. Featured in 'St. Omer ‚Äì A Family of Artists' exhibition at Mexican Embassy, Vigie (January 2017). Co-created televised painting tutorial programme with Alwyn St. Omer.

Collective of visual artists who meet regularly to rejuvenate interest in art and make it a ubiquitous staple in public spaces. Members include Ken Lawrence (President), Solange Lawrence, Gary Butte, Cedric George, Nancy Cole-Auguste, Janet Lang, Jean Mederick, Chester Williams, and Nicole Edgecombe (PR Officer). Regular exhibitions at Alliance Francaise. Email: acstlicia@gmail.com
services.a: Castries, Saint Lucia (meets at Alliance Francaise, The Pyramid, Pointe Seraphine)

services.d: Art gallery at Point Seraphine duty-free shopping complex. Features work by local and international artists. Accommodates large and small budgets. Convenient location for cruise ship visitors.
Art gallery offering art and craft activities for visitors and locals. Features browseable art by local artists. Active on Instagram with art community engagement.

Swiss artist who has spent much of each year on Saint Lucia for over 20 years. Frequent artist-in-residence at Anse Chastanet since 1997. Created colourful ceiling mural in Anse Chastanet's Emerald Vegan restaurant and abstract paintings for hotel rooms. Works include watercolors, assemblages, artist's books, installations, and silk scarves. Celebrated for themes of color and ornament. Exhibited in Swiss museums and recognized in contemporary Swiss art.
services.a: Soufriere (based in Switzerland, second home in Saint Lucia for 20+ years)

services.d: Contemporary German painter, co-founder of the Neue Wilde movement. Created 'The Piton Series' (2025) during stay at Jade Mountain. Long-running collaboration with Anse Chastanet Resort. Abstract painting style captures essence of Saint Lucia ‚Äî palm trees, beach scenes, local fruit. Female figures painted in sinuous black lines against patterned backgrounds reminiscent of Matisse. Based permanently in Saint-Tropez since 2001.
services.a: Soufriere / Jade Mountain (based in Saint-Tropez, France; visiting artist)

services.d: Berlin-based German artist who has visited Anse Chastanet multiple times as artist-in-residence. Murals in the Anse Chastanet restaurant. Created acrylic and ceramic tile paintings designed for specific settings at the resort, inspired by Saint Lucia's vibrant colors and scenic beauty.

Well-known German painter of New Figuration. Frequent traveller whose work at Anse Chastanet captures the vegetation and light of Saint Lucia. Created acrylic and ceramic tile paintings for specific resort settings. Colorful paintings capturing magical moments and dreamy understanding of reality. Represented by Galerie VON&VON.

German artist whose bold, hand-painted renderings of free-spirited women adorn rooms at Anse Chastanet Resort. Has visited the resort regularly for 25+ years as artist friend of owner Karolin Troubetzkoy. Spirited paintings of women in the Royal Palm suite valued at $150,000. Focuses on colorful portraits of women and themes of femininity.

British artist who has contributed acrylic paintings to Anse Chastanet Resort in Saint Lucia. Work designed and completed specifically for resort settings, inspired by the vibrant colors and scenic beauty of Saint Lucia.
Dutch-Canadian artist who created ceramic tile paintings for Anse Chastanet Resort. Work designed and completed for specific settings at the resort, inspired by Saint Lucia's natural beauty.

Guyanese artist who lived and painted in Saint Lucia in his later years until his death in 2019. Outstanding member of the second wave of Guyanese artists (1950s). Changed the concept of landscape painting in Guyana. Coordinated mounting of 36 art exhibitions for first Carifesta (1972). In Saint Lucia, continued painting flora and landscapes with his signature passion for light and colour. Work displayed at Anse Chastanet. Taught art at multiple institutions. Shows in Sussex, Dominica, Barbados, and Saint Lucia.

Master sculptor and son of famed Saint Lucian sculptor Vincent Joseph Eudovic. Known for minimalistic and conceptual wooden block sculptures embodying themes of uplift, perseverance, and community. Created government-commissioned public monument 'All In' for Castries waterfront. Work commissioned as gifts for Prince Harry, Prince Charles, PM of Norway, President of Mexico, and head of the UN. Erected seven monumental sculptures in Chinese cities. Exhibited at Miami (2019), Zari Gallery London (2016), 532 Gallery New York (2017). Received 2024 SUNSHINE Award for visual arts contribution.

London-based Saint Lucian artist, filmmaker, and historian. Daughter of John Compton, first PM of Saint Lucia. BA in Photography from London College of Printing (2005). Photographed influential figures in Finance and Banking for major UK publishers. Work explores disparities in Afro Caribbean representation. Award-winning filmmaker (Best Documentary, Best Director at Caribbean Film & Fashion Awards). Founded 'Know Your Caribbean' ‚Äî number one online platform for Caribbean history and culture. Featured in CDF Emancipation Art Exhibition (2014). Runs world's first 100% non-profit Carnival section.

Saint Lucian artist creating paintings inspired by the island. Works include 'Saint Lucia Area Code 758' (tropical scene with palm trees, setting sun behind Piton mountain), 'Pink Sand St Lucia Beaches', and various Pitons and coastal scenes. Sells work through Fine Art America.

Intuitive artist and clinical psychologist. Specializes in acrylics and mixed media. Paints with fingers instead of brushes 90% of the time. Public Relations Officer for Artist Circle Saint Lucia. Art workshop facilitator. Trained under Arnold Toulon and Ken Lawrence. Exhibited at La Place Carenage, National Archives, and MeCurator. Email: nedgecombeart@gmail.com
services.no: Email: nedgecombeart@gmail.com

services.d: Watercolour and acrylic painter. Gallery at #16 Bay Street, Soufriere on the waterfront. Open daily 8am-2pm plus Friday nights at Stonefield Estate. Born in Aruba to Saint Lucian and Kittitian parents. Childhood in Soufriere, career in London fashion (model, commercial director). Returned to Saint Lucia in 1992. Focuses on landscapes, scenes, and stylised portraits with emphasis on light and colour.

Saint Lucia's premier landscape and fine art photographer. Born and raised on the island, photographed from age 9. Completed a 365-day photograph-a-day project documenting Saint Lucia. Published in numerous books, magazines, and calendars. Former financial analyst in Los Angeles. Studied business at Arizona State University. Influenced by Edward Weston and Galen Rowell. Member of Artist Circle.

Emerging contemporary Saint Lucian artist known for 'dream-like pieces'. Featured at MeCurator Art Gallery in inaugural exhibition and subsequent 'Koule' show. One of the younger artists (18+) represented by MeCurator alongside established veterans. Works weave colourful tales of nature, myth, love and the human form.

Saint Lucian visual artist. Featured at MeCurator Art Gallery in multiple exhibitions including inaugural show and 'Koule' exhibition. Part of a collective of Saint Lucian artists showcased alongside Adjani John, Junette Alexander, and Alcina Nolley.

London-based abstract and graphic artist, exhibitor, and curator. Born and raised in Castries. Student of City and Guilds of London Art School; won awards at 2017 exhibition. Creates handmade pieces from precious metals with semi-precious stones, paintings, jewelry, hand-printed textiles, specialist paper. Exhibition 'Vintage Journey - The Paradise' at Castries City Hall (Nov 2024). Former National Carnival Queen (1975).

Professional Saint Lucian artist working primarily with acrylics. BFA from Ontario College of Art and Design University. Range from realistic to surrealistic with strong female figures, plus fabulist/fantastic strands inspired by speculative fiction. Vibrant colour use identified as distinctly Saint Lucian. Collaborates with poet John Robert Lee on 'Song and Symphony' (2017). Cover artist for Lee's 'Pierrot' collection. Featured at MeCurator's 'Koule' exhibition.
services.a: Saint Lucia (born); based in Oshawa, Canada

services.d: Grenadian-born painter based in Saint Lucia. Distinguished by bright colour palette. Paintings featured in art galleries throughout the Caribbean region. Exhibited at 'Women in Art' at National Archives (2018). Featured in St. Lucia Star profile on her colourful imagery and artistic practice.

Saint Lucian politician and accomplished visual artist. Former President of the Senate (2018-2021). Paints in oil, acrylic, and pastel. Paintings in public and private collections locally, regionally, and internationally. Dedicated to development of various cultural artforms. Chair of Cultural Development Foundation. Exhibited at 'Women in Art' (2018).

Collective of nine Saint Lucian visual artists. Members include Nancy Cole-Auguste, Gary Butte, Cedric George, Janet Lang, Ken Lawrence, Solange Lawrence, Jean Mederick, Chester Williams, and Nicole Edgecombe (PR Officer). Group exhibition 'Perspectives' held at Alliance Francaise (2016). Hosts children's art workshops. Advocates for artists' rights and development.

English-born painter who grew up in London and Dominica, settled in Saint Lucia with husband Leo. Co-operates Choiseul Art Gallery. Paints in oil, watercolour, acrylic, and drawings. Often paints on location capturing Saint Lucia landscapes, portraits, and cultural scenes. Also produces greetings cards (Hattie's Cards), books, and prints. Studied art at college in East London in the 1980s.

Master traditional potter in Choiseul using techniques passed down from indigenous Amerindian methods. Creates pottery including coal pots and canawi (traditional round-bottomed cooking pots). Clay dug locally in the shadow of Gros Piton. Pottery available at Vin's Boutique in Choiseul. Offers pottery classes by booking. Part of a matrilineal tradition of mothers teaching daughters.

Saint Lucian visual artist. Work titled 'Politricks' exhibited at Barbados Community College Fine Arts program (2013). Featured in 'Women in Art' exhibition at National Archives (2018). Active in local and regional art exhibitions.

Saint Lucian textile and visual artist. Began with fabric painting to create 'wearable art' ‚Äî beach wraps, kaftans, kimonos, and rectangular scarves. Evolved from visual art into textile design. Prefers the title 'textile artist'. Well-known designer in Saint Lucia. Featured in 'Handmade Saint Lucia' showcase and 'Women in Art' exhibition at National Archives (2018).
Saint Lucian visual artist. Featured in 'Women in Art' exhibition at National Archives (2018) as part of the Nobel Laureate Festival celebrations.
Saint Lucian visual artist. Featured in 'Women in Art' exhibition at National Archives (2018) as part of the Nobel Laureate Festival celebrations.
Saint Lucian visual artist. Featured in 'Women in Art' exhibition at National Archives (2018). Note: Not to be confused with the American artist of the same name.

Saint Lucian visual artist. Featured in 'Women in Art' exhibition at National Archives (2018) as part of the Nobel Laureate Festival celebrations.

Guyanese-born, Canadian-educated artisan, tourism consultant, and restaurateur based in Saint Lucia. Creates fashion jewelry. Founded Island Mix Art Emporium and Designs by Nadia brand. Runs Caribbean Network Development group giving 80+ local artisans greater bargaining power. Offers art classes, paint parties, and pottery sessions. Located on Rodney Bay waterfront with cafe and AirBnB.

services.n: Pat Charles Endowment for the Arts (PCEA)
services.d: Endowment established by Adrian Augier in 2010 following his Caribbean Laureate of Arts and Letters award, honouring Pat Charles (1936-2010). Provides grants to students, supports publications, and funds exhibitions for Saint Lucian visual and literary artists. Supported by JQ Charles Group and University of the West Indies. Funded Ken Lawrence's Pyramid exhibition. Key institution for arts funding in Saint Lucia.

Multi-disciplinary Saint Lucian artist ‚Äî visual art, performance art, literary art. Recipient of six St. Lucia National Arts Awards. First Eastern Caribbean Laureate of Arts and Letters. Co-founded Lighthouse Theatre (1983) and Factory Creative Arts Centre (1997). Poet ('Bridgemaker'). Honorary degree from UWI. Founded PCEA endowment to support local artists. Also economist and cultural consultant.
Art gallery in the Rodney Bay area. Active Instagram presence with 256+ posts showcasing local and regional artwork. Features paintings, prints, and mixed media by Saint Lucian and Caribbean artists.

French cultural institution established in Saint Lucia since 1953. Hosts art exhibitions, cultural events, and creative exchanges promoting Saint Lucian artists. Venue for Ken Lawrence exhibition (2025), Gary Butte's first exhibition (2001), Artist Circle events, children's art workshops. Key institutional supporter of the visual arts in Saint Lucia alongside CDF.

Professional web and graphic designer with 20+ years of commercial experience. BA in Electronic Media Design from Sunderland University. Co-Director at eMagine Solutions Inc. Services include corporate branding/identification, logo design, print design (flyers, booklets, letterheads, menus), web design, UI/UX design, image manipulation, and SEO. One of the most established graphic designers on the island.

Multidisciplinary design studio run by Kevin. Helps ambitious businesses create professional and credible presence online and in person. Services include web design and development, graphic design, food photography, brand identity design, and website maintenance/management. Specializes in clean graphic design, strong branding, and user-friendly layouts for small businesses. Capabilities include online booking, product sales, client info capture, and membership subscriptions.

CEO and Brand Strategist with 15+ years in advertising, creative design, and brand development. BA in Corporate Communications from Baruch University, NYC. Returned from New York to establish Bold Inc., a brand consulting business bridging international best practices with Caribbean cultural flavor. Services include brand strategy, identity, communications, brand engagement, reputation and brand management, graphic design, logo design, package design. Notable clients include Saint Lucia Tourist Board (Jazz & Arts Festival identity), U4RIA carnival brand (creative director), Flow St. Lucia. Team includes Dahlia Guard (Event Planner), Jelani Paul (Filmmaker), and Sammie Altius (Designer).

Graphic design and event photography studio owned and managed by Isabelle Sankar. She is also a Senior Graphic Designer/Event Photographer at Voice Publishing. Services include annual reports, magazines, brochures, printed materials, and photography. Listed among the notable graphic designers in Saint Lucia.

Web and graphic design studio offering comprehensive suite of web and graphic media solutions at competitive pricing. Services include web design (custom website development), graphic design (logo design, business cards, billboards, letterheads), and corporate branding (brand identity development). Has been growing a reputation for helping enterprises achieve their development goals.

Caribbean identity and brand specialists with 25+ years of experience. Services include identity design, communication tools, branding (custom-built strategies), authentic content creation, award-winning labels, packaging and identity design, web development, information architecture, and online/traditional media implementation. One of the longest-established design firms in the region.

Full-service marketing communications company founded in 1998 by Agnes Francis (originally as RAM Public Relations, rebranded in 2003). The largest full-service marketing communications company in the OECS. Services include graphic design, television and radio production, web development and marketing, corporate branding, market research, event management, and marketing promotions/campaigns. Offices in St. Lucia and Grenada with affiliates in all OECS islands.

Full-service digital marketing agency based in Saint Lucia. Has worked on over 250 Caribbean website design projects in Saint Lucia and the wider region, UK and US. Services include digital marketing strategy, website design, SEO, SEM, social media marketing, email marketing, and content marketing. Serves clients across the region from Haiti and Jamaica to Trinidad and Guyana, as well as US, UK, Europe, UAE and Australia.

Digital marketing agency founded by Juelle Cadette. Specializes in digital marketing, design, and brand promotions. Notable work includes Bank of Saint Lucia (BOSL) campaign that achieved viral acclaim and exceeded financial goals by 10%. Services include social media campaigns, multimedia content, design, and brand promotions.

Full-service communications consulting firm with over a decade of experience in branding, communications and marketing strategies. Services include PR services, design and branding, research, media relations, strategic planning, advertising, and event promotion. Located at #4 2nd Floor Karlione Court, Rodney Bay.

Caribbean-based software development and web design agency. Amalgamation of four ICT companies with experience nearly as old as the internet in St. Lucia. Has built over 300 websites, databases and applications. Services include professional website design/development, SEO, e-commerce solutions, custom application development, custom database systems, web hosting and domain registration. Chris Gardiner is co-Director.

Signs and graphics company offering signage design and production services. Listed in FindYello under Signs category for the Gros Islet area.
Signage and promotional materials company. Services include advertising signs, glass art, and general business signage solutions. Open Monday-Saturday 8am-5pm.

services.d: Signs and digital printing company offering signage design, production and digital printing services. Cell: +1-758-720-2308.

Graphic design and printing solutions business based in Soufriere. Services include logo design, t-shirt printing, 3D license plates, regular license plates, business cards, flyer design, vehicle decals, vehicle side strips, and vinyl signs. Available via Shopfront platform.
services.a: Ti Bough, Fond St. Jacques, Soufriere

services.d: One of the leading printing companies on the island. Specializes in vehicle wraps, signs, billboards, banners, posters, number plates, graphic designs, and bus-stop branding. Full graphic design services available.
services.a: Marisule Industrial Estate, Rodney Bay, Gros Islet

services.d: Major printing company covering large and small projects. Services include architectural prints, brochures, posters, business cards, binders, and reports. One of the leading names in Saint Lucia printing.
Printing and graphics company based in central Castries. Offers printing services and graphic design. Also known as Optimum Printing and Graphics on Instagram. Secondary phone: 758-453-7043.
Promotional products and printing company based in Rodney Bay. Offers custom promotional printing services.

services.n: Jackie's Printing Services & MacIntosh Support Group
services.d: Graphic design and printing services. Listed under Graphic Designers category in FindYello for Saint Lucia. Also offers MacIntosh/Apple computer support.

Full-service advertising, marketing and public relations company that has been serving Saint Lucia businesses for 15+ years. Regarded as one of the country's premiere agencies. Services include print design (magazine advertisements, posters, logos), graphic design, web development, PR, marketing campaigns, and publishing (St. Lucia Business Focus magazine). Graphic designers on staff include Deri Benjamin and Cecil Sylvester. Managing Editor: Lokesh Singh.

Full-service marketing agency with over 15 years of combined industry experience. Services include innovative marketing strategies, brand identity development, graphic design, and public relations. Listed as a graphic designer on St Lucia Business Online.

Custom stamp provider and one-stop shop for stamps and accessories. Also customizes mugs, plates and shirts for special occasions. Two locations: Rodney Bay (758-572-7850) and Castries (758-452-4551).
services.a: JQ Mall, Rodney Bay / Valmont Building, Laborie Street, Castries

services.d: Printing and supplies company based in Castries. Offers general printing services.
T-shirt printing and retail company. Offers custom t-shirt design and printing services. Multiple locations in Vieux Fort.
Printing services company based in Grand Riviere, Gros Islet.

Abstract artist and designer, originally from Dominica, living in Saint Lucia since early 1990s. Studied at Edna Manley School of Visual Arts in Jamaica (textiles, graphics, jewellery, sculpture, painting). Influenced by Dali and Picasso. In 1994, gave up traditional brushes and started painting with used phone cards, etching into surfaces with an ice pick. Exhibited in Paris, Cuba, Austria. Work hangs in many Caribbean corporate headquarters. Has done exhibitions across the region, America, and Europe. Teaches art classes at Anse Chastanet Resort.

Young Saint Lucian visual artist, painting for 7+ years. Works at The Montessori Centre and tutors in visual arts. Specializes in painting, mixed media, and drawing with a focus on realism with an undertone of abstract concept. Influenced by teacher Ted Sandiford. Plans to develop an afterschool art program and create an art gallery for established and emerging artists. Advocates for relevance of local visual art forms in Saint Lucia.

Educator, media artist, animator and illustrator born 1980 in Saint Lucia. Pursued degree in Media Arts and Animation at Art Institute of Pittsburgh. Also holds degree in Teacher Education from SALCC. Career began as freelance animator, known for combining traditional hand-drawn techniques with digital technologies. Owner of A.C.I.D. Kreationz (Media Arts and Animation). Currently lectures Animation and Design at community college. Former Visual Arts Teacher at secondary school. Illustrated Saint Lucian folktales.

Elderly artist from Anse La Raye. Was tutored in painting by American artist Nell Blaine in the 1960s when she visited Saint Lucia. Later also carved and painted canoes. Part of a group of Anse La Raye village artists supported by Nick Troubetzkoy (owner of Anse Chastanet) dating back to the 1980s, resulting in a collection of over 1,000 artworks.

Saint Lucian painter from Anse La Raye. Son of Wills Lamontagne, who learned painting from American artist Nell Blaine. Continued his father's artistic tradition. Part of the Anse La Raye village artists community.

Painter from Anse La Raye village. Part of a group of local artists supported by Nick Troubetzkoy (Anse Chastanet Resort owner) since the 1980s, alongside Mark Fedee and Matthew Paul. The collective produced a collection of over 1,000 artworks.

Painter from Anse La Raye village. Part of a group of local artists supported by Nick Troubetzkoy (Anse Chastanet Resort owner) since the 1980s. Member of the Anse La Raye artists community alongside Calixte George and Matthew Paul.

Saint Lucian artist born in Anse La Raye, living near Soufriere. Known for colourful painted ceramics, calabash, and acrylic on canvas. Subjects include the Pitons, coral reefs, birds, flowers, and countryside scenes. Painted decorative wall murals at Anse Chastanet's beach restaurant and bar, and created 'sky' ceiling murals in guest rooms. Work featured in the Anse Chastanet gallery. Deceased (lost during Hurricane Tomas).

services.n: Winston Fevrier (Melting Pot West Indian Studio)
services.d: Master wood carver and artist. Operates Melting Pot West Indian Studio, a gallery perched on a cliff overlooking Anse La Raye village. Specializes in hand-carved and hand-painted masks from native woods, word art, and custom carvings. Wide range of styles and prices. Known for genuine, high-quality handcrafted artwork. Highly rated on TripAdvisor.

American-born artist and jewelry maker residing in Saint Lucia since 1992. BA from State University of Buffalo Teacher's College. Creates one-of-a-kind handmade jewelry (fine silver, sterling silver, precious and semiprecious gems), paintings, and crafts. Gallery at 7A Tradewinds Crescent, Coubaril, Castries. Offers one-day classes in metal clay and enameling. Art Clay Senior Instructor. Work reflects her love of Saint Lucia.

services.d: International artist known for panoramic landscape paintings. Work represented at Anse Chastanet Art Gallery in Soufriere alongside works by Stefan Szczesny, Claude Sandoz, and Elvira Bach.

services.n: School of Art and Design Saint Lucia
services.d: Founded in 2005 by Signa Greaves-Francis. The only art and design institution in Saint Lucia, self-described as 'The Caribbean's Premiere Creative School'. Offers Certificate and Diploma Programs in Fine Arts, Fashion Design, Interior Design, Graphic Design, Web Design, Animation, and Photography. Also offers Summer Art Programs and professional workshops. Located along Marisule/Gros Islet highway.

Saint Lucia-based artist who co-opened a gallery with Arnold Toulon at Bois d'Orange, Gros Islet. Part of the local art community exhibiting at galleries around the north of the island. Limited online presence.

Born in Saint Lucia, self-taught artist and accomplished restaurateur. Well-known painter and potter whose ceramics, paintings, and silk-screen prints are in demand. Hand-painted ceramic serving bowls, jugs, and vases inspired by Saint Lucian fruits and daily life. Brand name 'Wild Orchid Designs'. Operates The Pink Plantation ‚Äî a restored French colonial house that combines restaurant, guest house, and art gallery. Also runs The Coal Pot restaurant with her husband. Instagram following of 1,683+. Pieces sold at galleries and through The Pink Plantation.

Wood sculptor trained by master sculptor Vincent Joseph Eudovic from the age of five during summer vacations. After graduating high school, continued studying wood sculpting, training at the Choiseul handicraft centre and in Canada where he lived and worked for over 10 years.
